title: big_boss
body:
The biological father of [[Liquid Snake]], [[Solidus Snake]], and [[Solid Snake]]. He was forced to kill his mentor [[The Boss]] during the Cold War in Operation Snake Eater, and later built his own private army, also started the Outer Heaven Uprising. Known as the "greatest soldier of the 20th century" for his superhuman strength despite the apparent lack of body modifications.

Voiced by David Hayter/Kiefer Sutherland in North America, and [[Ootsuka Akio]] in Japan.

h4. See also

* [[Naked Snake]]
* [[Venom Snake]]

title: heist_fashion_octane

In this appearance he has [[brown hair]] worn in a short [[mohawk]] and wears a [[blue hoodie]] over a [[black bodysuit]].

[[Lifeline (apex legends)|]]'s appearance in the short was also added to the game as the [[mischief medic lifeline|Mischief Medic]] skin.

Protagonist of [i][[Final Fantasy XV]][/i].
The 20-year old prince of a province who is set to marry [[Lunafreya Nox Fleuret]], but his life takes a detour when his kingdom and his [[regis lucis caelum|father]] perish in an enemy attack. title: heiter
body:
Heiter was the alcohol-loving priest of the Hero Party, which consisted of [[himmel (sousou no frieren)|Hero Himmel]], [[Frieren|Mage Frieren]], and [[eisen (sousou no frieren)|Warrior Eisen]]. Heiter is known as a drunkard, which is why Frieren calls him a "Corrupt Priest".

Many years later, he would adopt a [[aged down|young]] [[Fern (sousou no frieren)|]], who he would entrust to Frieren as an apprentice before he passed.

Heiter is a [[glasses|bespectacled]] Priest with short [[green hair]] that he keeps [[hair slicked back|slicked back]]. A few pieces of hair frame his face.

title: yuki_miku_(2018)
body:
"Crane Priestess"

The 2018 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. The theme of the design contest for this year was "Animal" with the image of Hokkaido winter and snow. The winning entry was done by [[Liita (dusk snow)|]] and features a crane-themed [[miko]] outfit with [[white hair]], [[chihaya (clothing)|]], [[striped thighhighs]], and holding a [[kagura suzu]]. 

Her fan nickname is "Tanchou", meaning [[red-crowned_crane|Japanese crane]]. 

Her theme song is [[Shikakui Chikyuu wo Maruku Suru (Vocaloid)|]] by TOKOTOKO.

h4. "Finalists":[https://event.goodsmile.info/snowmiku2018/]

title: columbo
body:
[b]Columbo[/b] is an American crime drama starring Peter Falk as [[lieutenant columbo|Lieutenant Columbo]], a homicide detective with the Los Angeles Police Department. The show originally aired from 1971 to 1978 and was later continue in a series of special episodes from 1989 to 2003.

Unlike most crime dramas where the hero finds clues and discovers the real culprit at the end of the episode, the culprit is seen in the beginning of the episode committing the crime and covering their tracks which Columbo later tries to figure out and prove how the culprit committed the crime.

title: woah_pipe_bomb_(meme)
body:
Hatsune Miku Admires a Snail, also known as Hatsune Miku Admires a Pipe Bomb and Woah, Pipe Bomb, refers to a series of memes based on a fan art of [[Hatsune Miku]] looking at a snail and commenting, "snale, woaaaaaaaaaaa, so cool…" Originally posted in 2021, the image was used as an exploitable on Tumblr, with a version with a [[pipe bomb]] edited in instead of the snail later inspiring humorous fan animations.

title: sa-3_mozambique
body:
A hybrid [[energy gun|energy]] [[shotgun]]/[[handgun]] that appears in [[Titanfall 2]] and [[Apex Legends]].

While it's generally a decent weapon in Titanfall, it was heavily nerfed in Apex and was considered one of the worst weapons in the game at launch - to the point that it became [[mozambique here (meme)|a meme]]. Despite getting improvenents throughout the game's lifetime, Respawn still leans into the memes by including Mozambique-related gameplay gags in Apex's [[April Fools]] events.

title: madness_(band)
body:
[b]Madness[/b] are an [[united_kingdom|English]] ska and pop band from Camden Town, north [[London]], who formed in 1976. One of the most prominent bands of the late 1970s and early 1980s two-tone ska revival, they continue to perform with six of the seven members of their original line-up. Madness's most successful period was from 1980 to 1986, when the band's songs spent a total of 214 weeks on the UK Singles Chart.

Madness have had 16 singles reach the UK top ten, including "One Step Beyond", "Baggy Trousers" and "It Must Be Love", one UK number-one single "House of Fun" and two number ones in Ireland, "House of Fun" and "Wings of a Dove". 

"Our House" was their biggest US hit, reaching number 7 on the Billboard Hot 100. In 2000, the band received the Ivor Novello Award from the British Academy of Songwriters, Composers and Authors for Outstanding Song Collection.

title: macross_2
body:
[b][i]The Super Dimension Fortress Macross II: Lovers Again[/i][/b] (超時空要塞マクロスII [i]Lovers Again[/i], "Chō Ji-kū Yō-sai Ma-ku-ro-su" II - Lovers Again?), also known as [b]Super Dimensional Fortress Macross II[/b] or simply [b][i]Macross II[/i][/b], is the first animated sequel to [[choujikuu_yousai_macross|The Super Dimension Fortress Macross]] to feature a new cast of characters. This [[japan]]ese [[mecha]] anime OVA was released in May 21, 1992.

This series was produced by Big West only and is notable because it's the only [[Macross]] production that was developed without Studio Nue's and [[Kawamori Shouji]]'s (the original series creator and mecha designer) involvement. 

[[Mikimoto Haruhiko]] designed the new characters while Okuda Atsushi, Akutsu Junichi, Fujita Kazumi and [[Oohata Kouichi]] designed the mecha.

The story takes place in the year 2092, eighty years after the events depicted in the anime film [i]The Super Dimension Fortress Macross: Do You Remember Love?[/i]

Originally promoted as a canon sequel to the [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] theatrical movie, Macross II has since been relegated by Studio Nue as taking place in an alternate continuity and is no longer considered part of the original series canon. However, many books, toys, [[video game]]s and other officially sponsored products related to the series are still being produced.

title: order_of_the_red_banner
body:
A [[Soviet]] military decoration for heroism in combat, awarded from 1924-1991. Originally the highest honor in the Soviet armed forces, until surpassed by the [[Order of Lenin]] in 1930; however, the latter was not strictly reserved for military heroism. 

It consists of a white enamel badge with a golden [[hammer and sickle]], a red star, [[gold trim]] of wheat, and crossed items including a red flag with the motto "Workers of the World, unite" etched on it.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Order_of_the_Red_Banner]

title: order_of_the_patriotic_war
body:
A [[Soviet]] military decoration that was awarded to armed regulars, security, and partisans during [[World War II]] (also known as the Great Patriotic War, hence the order's name). 

It consists of a gold/silver rayed five-pointed star alongside a red five-pointed star, crossed with a saber and a Mosin-Nagant, and a central disc with the [[hammer and sickle]] inside. Certain portrayals (such as [[Pamiat Merkuria (retrofit) (azur lane)|]]) may replace the communist symbol for another to be acceptable to certain audiences, and/or may omit the crossed weapons. 

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Order_of_the_Patriotic_War]

title: cumulonimbus_cloud
body:
A dense, towering vertical [[cloud]].

Well-developed cumulonimbus clouds are characterized by a flat, anvil-like top (anvil dome), caused by wind shear or inversion near the boundary between the troposphere and the stratosphere.  These clouds are capable of producing lightning and other dangerous severe weather, such as tornadoes and hailstones.

h4. Types

* Cumulonimbus calvus: Latin for "bald", features a puffy top
* Cumulonimbus capillatus: Latin for "long hair", features ice crystal clouds that streak out at its top edge giving it a fibrous appearance
* Cumulonimbus capillatus incus: Also known as an "anvil cloud" (incus being Latin for anvil), features a flat, anvil-top shape

h4. Examples

* !post #2666937
* !post #3326870
* !post #4594627

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Cumulonimbus cloud":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cumulonimbus_cloud

title: sett
body:
A sett, usually the plural setts and in some places called a Belgian block, is a broadly rectangular quarried stone used originally for paving roads, today a decorative stone [[pavement|paving]] used in landscape architecture. Often incorrectly called "[[cobblestone]]". A sett is distinct from a cobblestone by being quarried or shaped to a regular form, whereas a cobblestone is generally naturally occurring.

h4. Examples

* !post #185475
* !post #1495517

body:

In some in-game illustrations and the "official 4koma":[/pools/19989], he is depicted as an adult, usually [[faceless_male|faceless]] male with slicked-back brown hair. When on duty, he wears a white [[military uniform]] and a white [[sailor hat]]. When off duty, he wears a [[black_shirt|black button-up shirt]].

title: london_calling
body:
[i]London Calling[/i] is a rock music album made by the English band [b][[The Clash]][/b] in 1979. The iconic "album cover":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:TheClashLondonCallingalbumcover.jpg] shows Paul Simonon violently smashing his bass against the floor. The remnants of the broken bass are on display in the "Museum of London":[https://www.museumoflondon.org.uk/museum-london/whats-on/exhibitions/clash-simonon-bass-guitar-display] ("archived":[https://web.archive.org/web/20240106203300/https://www.museumoflondon.org.uk/museum-london/whats-on/exhibitions/clash-simonon-bass-guitar-display]).

* !asset #20089909

Created by the one they call [[william (reverse collapse)|Father]]. Named Nytos are no longer referred to with that name, and are insulted if you use it.[/spoiler]

title: druze_star
body:
A [b]multicoloured [[pentagram]][/b] that symbolize the [b]five colours[/b] ("Five Limits" خمس حدود khams ḥudūd) of [b]Druze[/b] esoteric ethnoreligious group, despite the faith avoids iconography. The usage is as popular as the five-coloured flag with horizontal stripes. 

Each of the colors representing the five limits pertains to a metaphysical power called ḥadd, literally "a limit", as in the distinctions that separate humans from animals, or the powers that make humans the animalistic body. Each ḥadd is color-coded in the following manner:
* [b]Green[/b] for ʻAql "the Universal Mind/Intelligence/Nous",
* [b]Red[/b] for Nafs "the Universal Soul/Anima mundi",
* [b]Yellow[/b] for Kalima "the Word/Logos",
* [b]Blue[/b] for Sābiq (السابق) "the anterior/potentiality/cause/precedent", the first intellect.
* [b]White[/b] for al-llahiq (اللاحق) "the posterior/future/effect/Immanence".

The five-pointed star embodies the golden ratio, phi, as a symbol of temperance and a life of moderation. 
This looks similar with the Imperial Chinese "Beiyang Army":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beiyang_Army] symbol, but one side is [b]green[/b] instead of black.

* !asset #20083696

h4. External links
* [[tag group:symbols|list of symbols]]
* "symbols.com":[https://www.symbols.com/symbol/druze-star]
* Wikipedia article: "Druze":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Druze#Religious_symbol]

title: anson_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s planned personification of the battleship HMS [i]Anson[/i] (79).

Notably, she has a drastically different design compared to her sister ships, particularly being more [[loli|petite]] in size, and wearing a [[school swimsuit]]. This design was cancelled due to a backlash from playerbase, as the design was deemed "unfit" for her actual classification, with some believing that the design was originally intended to be used on a submarine shipgirl. Her place in the [i]From Zero to Hero[/i] event on March 28, 2024 was taken up by [[Friedrich Carl (Azur Lane)|]] as a solution while Anson is being redesigned. 

* !post #7365603: [[Anson (azur lane)|Default]]

title: vajra_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[vajra_(granblue_fantasy)|Vajra]] in her swimsuit.

On a clear summer's day, the current war deity finally gets her chance to visit the sea and revel in its cerulean beauty. Of course, the virtuous girl finds fun in every season of the year, and she loves all things in creation, mortal or otherwise.

title: anila_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[Anila_(granblue_fantasy)|Anila]] in her swimsuit.

The Queen of Sheep has landed on the beach, and she's more than ready to let her hair down in the spirit of summer. With her friends forever by her side, sheepish grins will be a thing of the past.

title: kumbhira_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[kumbhira_(granblue_fantasy)|Kumbhira]] in her swimsuit.

In her pursuit of someone she respects, the young Divine Boar visits the ocean for the first time. Captivated, she watches the sun sink into the golden, glistening waves. Though the glow of the sea is but momentary, memories of her time with her friends will stay in her heart forever.

title: long_sword
body:
A longsword is a type of European sword characterized as having a cruciform hilt with a grip for two-handed use.

A western-style/European sword used with two hands, typically from stomach height to armpit height. Any sword about as tall or taller than the wielder is a [[greatsword]]. Any shorter sword of the same style that can reasonably be held with only one hand is an arming [[sword]].

body:

The series recently released a manhwa/webtoon produced by Redice Studio and published by Naver Webtoon.

title: priapus
body:
Doujinshi artist [[itto_(mentaiko)]]'s [[bara]] [[doujinshi]] manga inspired by the Priapus mythos in 2011. 


Summary: 
[quote] Zeus is sick of all the hate, envy, and violence that humans cause on Earth. So he gives Priapus the important task of making all human males homosexual, in order to destroy any means of humans to leave behind children. Priapus descends to earth, meeting his first target, Ousuke Sakura. Part 2: Priapus continues the mission that Zeus sent him on. This time Priapus ends up in rural Japan and meets his next target, Honda, a police officer.[/quote]

It got so popular it even has gotten its own official English release.
From "Amazon":[https://www.amazon.com/Priapus-by-Mentaiko-1-Apr-2015-Paperback/dp/B011T72V4U] :
[quote] You can't imagine Japan's manga scene without Mentaiko Itto's amusing gay mangas anymore. Bruno Gm nder now publishes his works for the first time in English, introducing him to a broader audience. [/quote]

title: rinne_sharingan
body:
The Rinne Sharingan (literally meaning: Saṃsāra Copy Wheel Eye) is a dōjutsu kekkei mōra and the predecessor to the [[Rinnegan]] and [[Sharingan]] (and by extension their in-between stage, the [[Mangekyou Sharingan]]).

It is characterised by red sclerae and irides, with a [[ringed_eyes|ripple pattern]] spreading over the [[eyeball]] and nine [[tomoe (symbol)|]]. In its sole known user, it acts as a [[third eye]].

Note that [[uchiha sasuke|Sasuke]]’s variant of the Rinnegan is often tagged using this tag, even though that’s technically incorrect.

h4. Examples
* !post #7412733: [[Uchiha Sasuke|Sasuke]]'s [[Rinnegan]]

h5. Known users

* [[Ootsutsuki Kaguya]]

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Eyes Tags]]

title: ougon_bat
body:
[b]Ougon Bat[/b] (黄金 バット, [i]Ougon Batto[/i] "Golden Bat"), also known as [b]Phantoma[/b] in English, [b]Fantasmagórico[/b] in Spanish and [b]Fantaman[/b] in Italian, is a seminal Japanese superhero created by writer Ichiro Suzuki and illustrator Takeo Nagamatsu in 1930. 

Ougon Bat is considered to be the first true Japanese superhero franchise and preceded those of [[Superman]], [[Batman]] and many other western superheros by several years.

The titular character made his debut in [i][[Kamishibai]][/i], a traveling show in which a sequence of pictures is narrated by a storyteller. He was popular enough to survive the decline of Kamishibai after [[World War II]], and was eventually translated into movie and anime form.

A live action movie, [i]Ougon Bat: Matenro No Kaijin[/i], was released in 1950, followed by another in 1966, simply titled [i]Ougon Bat[/i], and starring Sonny Chiba. This was followed by another film, [i]Ougon Bat Ga Yattekuru[/i] in 1972.

A 52 episode anime series was produced and released in 1967. 

A remake of the first anime series called [[Ougon Bat: Millennium Version]] was announced in the late 90s but was never released. However, a trailer with modern animation was made to promote the new series. 

h4. Characters

* [[Ougon Bat (Character)|]]
* [[Marie Millet]]
* [[Yamatone Takeru]]
* [[Dr. Yamatone]]
* [[Dokono Dareo]]
* [[Peggy (Ougon Bat)|]]
* [[Dr. Erich Nazou]]
* [[Kurayami Bat]]

title: bukimi_isan
body:
Artist.

Japanese name: 不気味遺産 (Bukimi Isan)

Their style has heavy influence from western styles, particularly visible is Norman Rockwell, presenting a comical yet realistic take on the mimics, gestures, and expressions. The crisp shadings are their main attraction.

Their artworks mainly consist of [[Idolmaster]] 765Pro and explore the realistic, more humane sides of the characters.

Bukimi is currently working on the manga series '[[shy_(series)|SHY]]' which is being serialized on Weekly Shonen Champion.

title: backbeard
body:
A recurring antagonist from [[Gegege no Kitarou]], he first appeared in the [i]"Great Youkai War"[/i] story in 1966.

Described as a floating shadow with a single eye, he is the most powerful of all Western monsters and can submit anyone to his will with his gaze.

He achieved internet popularity in the 2000's with the [[kono lolicon domome]] meme. For his non-canonical daughter, see [[Backbeako (torotei)|]].

Not to be confused with the [i][[One Piece]][/i] character nicknamed Blackbeard, [[Marshall D. Teach]].

h4. See also

* Article: http://www.sankakucomplex.com/2008/09/28/beako-%E2%80%93-bane-of-lolicon/

title: koshirae_tsurugi_(m.m)
body:
Original character by [[m.m]].

She has [[brown hair]] with a touch of orange, which she keeps in a [[long hair|long]] [[ponytail]] save for medium length [[sidelocks]] and a pair of [[antenna hair|"hairtennae"]].  Her eyes are [[multicolored eyes|multicolored]]. Her usual outfit consists of a dark blue [[track jacket]] with orange trim and an [[ass|exceptionally flattering]] pair of [[bike shorts]].

Born into a family of rice planters, she has an older brother named [[Koshirae Kenji]] and a grandmother named [[Koshirae Chitose]]. She also has a pet penguin named [[Hijikata-san (m.m)|]]. She carries a [[short sword]], with which she is proficient and her sword style is the Karasuma-ryu (烏丸流) .

title: bubble_sheet
body:
A form with many blank circles, ovals, or boxes used to enter a person's answers to multiple choice questions. Also known as an "optical answer sheet." The sheets are designed to be scanned by an optical mark recognition (OMR) machine to save time in evaluating them.

The [i]Scantron Corporation[/i] in the United States is a major producer of OMR machines and forms, and operates in 98% of US school districts.  Given this prevalence, it has become normal to refer to these forms as a "scantron" in the US.

h4. See Also

* [[Academic test]]

h4. External Link

* "Wikipedia - Optical Answer Sheet":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Optical_mark_recognition#Optical_answer_sheet]
* "Wikipedia - Scantron Corporation":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scantron_Corporation]

title: rin_(senran_kagura)
body:
[[Senran Kagura]] character. [b]Rin[/b], also known by her alias as [b]"Suzune"[/b], is a teacher at the Hebijo Academy. Made her debut in [[Senran Kagura Burst]].

She always dreamt of being a "Super Ninja" and often sparred against [[Daidouji_(senran_kagura)|]]. As she was not meant to graduate as a training dummy had snuck up on her during the last moments of her test. [spoiler]In her peril, she was "saved" by [[Kiriya (senran kagura)|]] by disposing of the dummy who had snuck up on her.[/spoiler]

After the incident, she was later assigned a very dangerous mission by the state situated in a seaside cavern. Backed with a team of good-faction ninjas and a single Kagura to cleanse the yoma, the entire team was decimated with Rin being the sole survivor. An evil ninja team was then sent in and cleaned up the leftovers. Rin's young arrogance was shattered by her defeat, causing her to do nothing but cry while she recuperated in the hospital.

Deciding not to return to Hanzo as a failure, she was offered a teaching position at Hebijo Academy as "Suzune". She etched into her memory the phase [i]"Good accepts few, evil accepts all"[/i].

Her seiyuu is [[Mimori Suzuko]].

h4. External links

* "Kagurapedia: Rin":https://senrankagura.fandom.com/wiki/Rin

title: izutsumi
body:
[i][[Dungeon Meshi]][/i] character.

She's a [[cat girl|half-tallman, half-cat-monster]] who joined [[Laios Touden]]'s party relatively late in their adventure. She has [[cat ears]] and a [[cat tail]], [[black hair]]/[[black_fur|fur]], and wide [[yellow eyes]] with [[slit pupils]]. She wears a [[red scarf]], [[leather armor]], red [[bracer]]s, and a [[loincloth]].

Her personality could generously be described as "prickly", but is in the process of learning to work with others. She has poor table manners and is a picky eater, which often puts her at odds with [[Senshi (dungeon meshi)|]]. Before joining up with the protagonists, she was one of [[Shurou]]'s retainers, and was (relatively) close with [[Inutade]].

* "Adventurer's Bible entry":[https://mangadex.org/chapter/2e174cf7-3a47-4f8a-bcf7-14a69aeafd68/1]

title: chest_stand_handstand
body:
A difficult [[contortion]] position combining both a [[chest stand]] and a [[handstand]] in which the performer bends their back so that their legs are in front of their head whist also lifting themselves from the ground using their hands or elbows.

It is similar to the [[scorpion pose]], however two thigs are fundamentally different:
* The performer is always balancing themselves on their hands or elbows
* The positioning of the legs in front of the head is a result of bending the back rather than bending the legs

title: jibril_(no_game_no_life)
body:
A character in [[No Game No Life]].

Both the youngest and strongest of her race, [i]Flügel[/i]. Despite her politeness and overall sweet look, she is a walking person of mass destruction who looks down on the other races as inferior. After being defeated by [[sora_(no_game_no_life)|the]] [[shiro_(no_game_no_life)|siblings]] at [[shiritori|her own game]], she willingly swears loyalty to be their servant.

Jibril has [[long_hair|long]] [[pink hair]], [[wings|wi]][[feathered_wings|n]][[white_wings|g]][[angel_wings|s]] near [[low_wings|her hips]], [[cross]]-[[symbol-shaped_pupils|shaped]] pupils, and [[wing_ears|wing-shaped]] ears. Her default clothing typically leaves her [[midriff|mid]][[navel|riff]] and [[sideboob]] exposed. In addition, she also has a [[spiked halo|compass rose]] [[halo]] over her head.

Voiced by [[Tamura Yukari]].

title: snoopy
body:
Iconic character in the [[Peanuts (comic)|]] franchise. Snoopy is [[Charlie Brown]]'s pet dog, a white [[beagle]] who is somewhat anthropomorphic in that he verbalizes his thoughts through [[speech bubble|speech bubbles]] rather than words. Somehow the neighborhood kids understand him, and he has been treated as more human than dog.

Snoopy has become the official mascot of the Apollo Program and aviation in general due to his refusal to accept defeat; in the comics, he sends typescripts to publishing companies only to have them constantly rejected, and he likes to pretend that he's a World War I pilot fighting against the Red Baron in his 'Sopwith Camel' fighter plane (a.k.a. his doghouse).

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snoopy

Kachidoki: "イダテンの効果発動! このカード以下のレベルのモンスターとバトルする場合、相手モンスターの攻撃力は0となる!" (I activate "Idaten":[http://yugioh-arcv.wikia.com/wiki/Idaten_the_Conqueror_Victory_Star]’s effect! When this card battles against a lower level monster, that monster’s attack becomes zero!)
[[sakaki yuya|Yuuya]]: "エクシーズモンスターはレベルを持たない。よって効果は無効。" ([[xyz_card|Xyz]] "monsters":[http://yugioh-arcv.wikia.com/wiki/Dark_Rebellion_Xyz_Dragon] do not have levels. Therefore, that effect is negated.) [*1]
Kachidoki: [b]"何? レベルを持たないならレベル0ではないのか!?" (What? If it doesn’t have levels, doesn’t it mean that its level is 0?)[/b]

([*1]: Technically speaking, the effect cannot be activated in the first place.)
[/quote]

title: yu-gi-oh!_zexal
body:
Japanese name: 遊戯王ZEXAL
English official romanization: [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] ZEXAL

The fourth series and third spin-off of the [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] anime and manga series. As with the previous series, it focused on the new type of monsters: Xyz monster.

Set in an entirely different univerese from the [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters|first]] [[Yu-Gi-Oh! GX|three]] [[Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's|series]]. The series follows [[Tsukumo Yuma|Tsukumo Yuma]], a boy who is initially known as "the master of absolutely losing" for being bad at everything (including [i][[Duel Monster]][/i]). After his encounter with [[Astral_(yu-gi-oh!)|]], a powerful entity from the Astral world, Yuma is entrusted with a power of [[number_39_utopia|No. 39 - Utopia]], and were tasked to find all of the 100 "Number" Xyz monsters to save both of the Astral and human world from the otherworldly threats.

h4. Characters
See [[List of Yu-Gi-Oh! characters]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Yu-Gi-Oh! Zexal":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yu-Gi-Oh!_Zexal]
* "Yu-Gi-Oh! Wiki: ZEXAL":[https://yugioh.fandom.com/wiki/Yu-Gi-Oh!_ZEXAL]

title: yu-gi-oh!_5d's
body:
Japanese name: 遊戯王5D's
English official romanization: [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] 5D's (Five Dragons)

The third series and second spin-off of the Yu-Gi-Oh! anime franchises. It focuses on Synchro summoning, which were then the first new type of monster introduced into the card game, as well as [i]Speed Duel[/i], a shortened and fast-paced format of the game.

Set in a far future in New Domino city, where the poor were discriminated and confined within a slum called "Satellite" while also being forbaded from having any [i]Duel Monster[/i] deck. The series focus on [[Fudo Yusei|Fudo Yusei]], a talented outlaw duelist from Satellite who were chosen by the [[Crimson Dragon]] as one of the five [i]Signers[/i], a group of duelists chosen by five [[dragon]] cards destined to be united and fought against future global threats.

h4. Characters
See [[List of Yu-Gi-Oh! characters]]

* "Wikipedia: Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yu-Gi-Oh!_5D%27s]

title: yu-gi-oh!_gx
body:
Japanese name: 遊戯王GX
English official romanization: [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] GX (Generation Next)

The first major spin-off manga and anime series of [i]Yu-Gi-Oh![/i] franchises primarily revolves around Fusion summoned monsters. Produced by Studio Gallop and NAS. The series first aired in Japan from October 6, 2004 to March 26, 2008.

Set a few years after the events of [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters]] within the Duel Academy, a school delicated to the [i][[Duel Monster]][/i] card game. The series follows [[yuki judai|Yuki Judai]] (Jaden Yuki in the dub), an under-performing student who possess great duelling skill and an ability to contact with the spirit of the cards.

h4. Characters
See [[List of Yu-Gi-Oh! characters]]

title: manjoume_jun
body:
AKA: Chazz Princeton (English dub)

A main character from the anime [[Yu-Gi-Oh! GX]]. He has [[black hair]] and [[black eyes]]. Initially wears the Obelisk Blue uniform, but later switches to a custom black uniform for the rest of the series.

His main catchphrase is "One! Ten! Hundred! Thousand! Manjoume Thunder!" (一！十！百！先！万丈目サンダー！); part of the wordplay is that his surname uses the character for ten thousand ([i]man[/i], 万). He gets annoyed when someone (usually [[yuki judai|Juudai]]) fails to address him with the proper honorific.

title: mazaki_anzu
body:
[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters]] character. Known as Tea Gardner in the English dub.

[[Muto Yugi]]'s childhood friend, an extremely supportive girl with a lot of spirit for her friends. Although her dueling ability is decent and she used to defeat [[Jonouchi Katsuya]] in school (before [[Muto Sugoroku]] tutored Jounouchi), Anzu is not a game-player and her ability is well below that of Yuugi. She is athletic and secretly works at a fast food restaurant to save money; her dream is to attend dancing school in New York City.

title: jonouchi_katsuya
body:
AKA: Joey Wheeler (English dub)

[[Muto Yugi]]'s best friend. Initially nothing more than a street thug and former bully, He is touched by Yuugi's behavior towards him and they become loyal friends. Yuugi's grandfather [[Muto Sugoroku]] tutors him on how to play Duel Monsters. He is, initially, rather unskilled at the game. Made his progress through additional help from Yuugi, but he gains a knack for the game and eventually goes on to place second in the Duelist Kingdom Tournament, fourth in Battle City, but is eliminated early on in the KC Grand Championship Tournament.

Jonouchi is shown to have a very kind soul and eager willingness to help those he loves, but he also demonstrates a near lack of modesty and can be rather rash at times, making him a source of comic relief.

h4. See also
* [[Creepy Chin Joey Wheeler (meme)|]]

title: muto_sugoroku
body:
AKA: Solomon Mutou (English dub)

Grandfather of [[Muto Yugi]] in [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters]]. He found the [[Millennium Puzzle]] in his youth, on a trip to Egypt, and gave it to Yuugi as a present. He also tutored [[Jonouchi Katsuya]] on how to play the game of Duel Monsters.

title: bakura_ryou
body:
[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters]] character.

Bakura is a transfer student who becomes friends with the main group of the story. The holder of the [[Millennium Ring]], he has a dark half dwelling inside of him, much like Dark Yugi/[[Yami Yugi]]. This dark half [[Yami Bakura]] intends to collect all of the Millennium items, and quite clearly does not care for anyone who might get in his way. At the end of the story, it's revealed that the Spirit of the Millennium Ring is the evil being [[Zorc Necrophades]].

title: muto_yugi
body:
English official romanization: Muto Yugi

The protagonist of the manga and anime series [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters]]. He is a young boy whose body becomes inhabited by the spirit of an Ancient Egyptian pharaoh [[Atem]] (known for most of the series as [[Yami Yugi|Yami Yugi]]) when he completes the [[Millennium Puzzle]]. His signature card is the [[Dark Magician]]. He is a modern reincarnation of [[Atem]].

title: pegasus_j_crawford
body:
AKA: Maximillion Pegasus (English dub)

Chairman of Industrial Illusions and creator of the card game [b][[Duel Monster]]s[/b] in [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters]] universe. The core antagonist of the Duelist Kingdom arc, but later became supporting character afterwards.

As the creator of the card game Duel Monsters and also the discoverer of their ancient Egyptian roots, Pegasus often plays a key role throughout the anime due to his extensive knowledge of the game and its mysterious origins. He has a habit of calling [[Muto Yugi|Muto Yugi]] "Yugi-boy" and [[Kaiba Seto]] "Kaiba-boy" in the Japanese and edited English versions of the anime and manga, primarily to emphasize his bad Japanese. Despite his age, he has an obsession over cartoons, which inspired him to create his iconic [[Toon World]] cards.

Pegasus possess the "[[Millennium Eye]]", one of the seven Millennium items with an ability to read person's mind [spoiler]In which he obtained after his trip in Egypt which led him to the discovery of Duel Monsters[/spoiler]. He usually utilize this ability to his advantage during a card game [spoiler]before losing the eye to [[Yami Bakura]] in a shadow game[/spoiler].

[spoiler]In the Duelist Kingdom arc, Pegasus cooporated with "the Big Five", a group of disgraced former executive of Kaiba Corp., to take over the company from Kaiba by kidnapping his brother [[Kaiba Mokuba|Mokuba]], while also luring [[Yami Yugi|Yami Yugi]] into facing him in a shadow game by kidnapping Yugi's grandfather in an attempt to retrieve his [[Millennium Puzzle]] in hope of reviving his deceased lover/wife.[/spoiler]
other_names: ペガサス・J・クロフォード

title: yami_yugi
body:
[b]Alternate names[/b]: Yami (before season 5), The Nameless Pharaoh (before season 5), Dark Yugi, [[Atem]].

The spirit of Pharaoh [[Atem]] that has been sealed in the [[Millennium Puzzle]]. He is the main protagonist of the original [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters]] series, along with [[Muto Yugi|Muto Yugi]]. 

After Yugi solved the Millennium Puzzle, Yami Yuugi resided in Yugi's body and would take possession of it when Yugi or his friends were in danger. After Yugi became fully aware of Yami's existence, Yugi could voluntarily give control of his body to the Pharaoh.

title: summoned_skull
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 6
[b]Attribute:[/b] Dark
[b]Type:[/b] Fiend
[b]ATK:[/b] 2500
[b]DEF:[/b] 1600

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]] with [[green eyes]], [[demon]] [[horns]] and [[wings]]. It was known as "Summoned Demon" or simply "Demon" in the Japanese original release. However, its name was changed into "Summoned Skull" in the international release due to 4kids' policy of avoiding any religious reference. Which leads into various support card for it retroactively treat Summoned Skull as a part of the "Archfiend" ("Demon") archtype.

Well-known as one of the key monster of [[Muto Yugi]] in the earlier part of the story.

title: marik_ishtar
body:
The core antagonist in the second and third seasons in the anime of [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters]]. He serves as the third antagonist [[Muto Yugi]] faces in the manga. 

His family and ancestors are the tombkeepers of "The Nameless Pharaoh" ([[Atem]]). Marik's hatred of the Nameless Pharaoh compels him to disregard his duties as a tombkeeper and turn to a life of evil, eventually developing a split personality as a child. Unbeknownst to Marik, his split personality [[Yami Marik]] killed his father. 

He wanted to control all 3 Egyptian God Cards ([[Osiris the Sky Dragon]], [[Obelisk The Tormentor]], and [[The Winged Dragon of Ra]]) in order to "gain the powers of the Pharaoh" and set his family free of their burden. However, at the end of the saga, he realizes the error of his ways and apologizes for his reckless actions, in turn ridding himself of his split personality. Fulfilling his duty as tombkeeper, Marik returned to Egypt with his sister [[Ishizu Ishtar]] and adopted brother [[Rishid Ishtar]] to start a new life. The three of them later assisted Yugi and the Pharaoh in Season 5.
other_names: マリク・イシュタール

title: ac-bu
body:
AC-bu is a creative unit formed in 1999 by Adachi Tooru, Itakura Shunsuke, and 安藤真 that makes works for television programs and commercials. All three are graduates of "Tama Art University":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tama_Art_University (多摩美術大学).

h4. Members

* Adachi Tooru (安達亨)
* Itakura Shunsuke (板倉俊介)
* 安藤真

h4. Works

* 2014 - High-speed Picture Story Show [i]"Safe Driving Guide"[/i] (高速紙芝居 「安全運転のしおり」) "(Video)":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=09o0nRFAwN8.  This won the Jury Selection for the Entertainment division at the 18th "Japan Media Arts Festival":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_Media_Arts_Festival. [1]
** Award Page - "Japanese":http://archive.j-mediaarts.jp/festival/2014/entertainment/works/18ej_Anzen_unten_no_shiori/ | "English":http://archive.j-mediaarts.jp/en/festival/2014/entertainment/works/18ej_Anzen_unten_no_shiori/
*** "This is a high-speed kamishibai (Japanese storytelling with a series of pictures), featuring two performers using over 20 sketchbooks in rapid fire. The story is similar to television police documentaries, and employs various tricks and techniques to bring the filmic appeal of the genre and even the sense of speed in the car chases to brilliant analog life."
* Amamiya Pest Control commercials
* 2018, 2019, 2022 - "[[Bobunemimimmi]]"/"Bob Epic Team" and [[Hellshake Yano]] segments for [i][[Poptepipic]][/i]
* 2024 - [i][[Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising]][/i] [[April Fools]] event: "Fanblue Grantasy Rises: Versing"

title: emul_(shangri-la_frontier)
body:
A main character in [[shangri-la_frontier|Shangri-La Frontier]].

Emul, a female vorpal bunny, is an NPC character who assists [[hizutome_rakurou|Hizutome Rakurou]] in his adventures. She's usually depicted wearing a [[red_dress|red dress]] with a [[red_ascot|red ascot]], a [[blue_coat|blue coat]], a [[top_hat|top hat]] with a [[monocle]].

She also has a [[bracelet]] hidden underneath her sleeve, which allows her to transform into a human form for a short duration. Her human form is a short girl with [[medium_hair|medium]] length, [[white_hair|white]] and [[pink_hair|pink]] [[multicolored_hair|multicolored hair]], with an oversized [[pocket_watch|pocket watch]] and identical clothes to her bunny form.

title: cul
body:
CUL is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Internet Co., Ltd. in collaboration with [[VOCALO Revolution]], and was released for the VOCALOID3 engine. She was initially introduced as VOCALO Revolution's mascot before receiving a Vocaloid voice bank. 

Her current design has a corset-like top, black [[shorts]] with a [[garter belt]] attached to [[striped thighhighs]]. She wears [[knee boots]] and a [[black coat]].

CUL was released without background information. She later received information updates through out the years, notably new siblings [[WINDCUL]], [[WhiteCUL]], [[MOONCUL]], [[BLACKCUL]] and [[Rosa (cevio)|]], while she is sometimes referred to as RE:CUL or REDCUL to distinguish her from her sisters.

h4. Official art

* !post #1161755: [[cul (vocalo revolution)|VOCALO Revolution]]
* !post #1039654: VOCALOID

title: frogman
body:
[tn]Not to be confused with [[Frogman (manga)]].[/tn] 
A frogman, also called a combat diver, is a [[soldier]] trained operations involving [[swimming]] and [[scuba]] diving. They typically use a close-circuit [[rebreather]] for stealth purposes, since an open-circuit [[scuba]] generates [[bubble|bubbles]] and noise. Examples of units who employ frogmen include the "U.S Navy SEALs":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Navy_SEALs and the "Danish Frogman Corps":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frogman_Corps_(Denmark). [[an-94 (girls' frontline)|AN-94's]] "[[an-94 (the diving bell and the doll) (girls' frontline)|The Diving Bell and the Doll]]" costume from [[Girls' Frontline]] is clearly meant to be a frogman.

Only use this tag if a character is wearing [[scuba gear|equipment]] that is clearly for military use (e.g. post #3151793) or it is known that they are an active soldier (e.g. [[an-94 (the diving bell and the doll) (girls' frontline)|AN-94]])

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frogman]

title: dogmatika_ecclesia_the_virtuous
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 4
[b]Attribute:[/b] Light
[b]Type:[/b] Spellcaster / Effect
Cannot be destroyed by battle with a monster Special Summoned from the Extra Deck. You can only use each of the following effects of "Dogmatika Ecclesia, the Virtuous" once per turn. If a monster Special Summoned from the Extra Deck is on the field: You can Special Summon this card from your hand. If this card is Normal or Special Summoned: You can activate this effect; add 1 "Dogmatika" card from your Deck to your hand, except "Dogmatika Ecclesia, the Virtuous", also you cannot Special Summon monsters from the Extra Deck for the rest of this turn.

[b]ATK:[/b] 1500

title: chito_(shoujo_shuumatsu_ryokou)
body:
One of the two main characters of [[Shoujo Shuumatsu Ryokou]], alongside [[yuuri_(shoujo_shuumatsu_ryokou)|Yuuri]]. She is serious, empathetic and calm, often thinking about complex matters and reflecting on life. She is literate and keeps a journal of their trip, and is the main driver of their [[Kettenkrad]] half-track.

She has [[black hair|black hair]] kept in [[low twintails]] and round [[black_eyes|black]] eyes, and wears a round [[brodie_helmet|brodie]] [[helmet]] with her winter [[military uniform]], , composed of a [[green_coat|green coat]] with a [[red_cross|red]] [[cross|cross]] on her left arm, [[black gloves]], [[green_pants|green pants]] and [[brown_footwear|brown shoes]]

title: all_quiet_on_the_western_front
body:
[b]All Quiet On The Western Front[/b] (German: [b]Im Westen Nichts Neues[/b], lit. [i]'Nothing New In The West'[/i]) is a novel by "Erich Maria Remarque":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erich_Maria_Remarque, a [[germany|German]] veteran of [[World War I]]. 

The book describes the German [[soldier]]s' extreme physical and mental trauma during the [[war]] as well as the [[ptsd|shell shock]] and detachment from civilian life felt by many upon returning home from the war.

The novel was first published in November and December 1928 in the German newspaper Vossische Zeitung and in book form in late January 1929. The book and its sequel, The Road Back (1930), were among the books banned and burned in Nazi Germany. All Quiet on the Western Front sold 2.5 million copies in 22 languages in its first 18 months in print.

Three film adaptations of the book have been made, each of which was lauded. The 1930 American adaptation, directed by Lewis Milestone, won two Academy Awards. The 1979 British-American adaptation, a television film by Delbert Mann, won a Golden Globe Award and an Emmy Award. The 2022 German adaptation, directed by Edward Berger, won four Academy Awards.

The book entered the public domain in the United States in 2024, with the 1930 film adaptation set to do so in 2026.

title: chuan_guo_yu_xi
body:
The [b]Heirloom Seal of the Realm[/b] (传国玉玺), also known in English as the [b]Imperial Seal of China[/b], was a Chinese jade seal allegedly carved out of the Heshibi, a sacred piece of jade. The Seal was created in 221 BC, shortly after [[Qin Shi Huang]] unified China and established the [[Qin dynasty]],  [[Chinese Empire|China's first imperial dynasty]]. The Heirloom Seal served as the imperial Chinese seal throughout the next millennium of Chinese history, and its possession was seen as a physical symbol of the Mandate of Heaven.

At the end of the Western [[Han dynasty]] in 9 CE, Wang Mang, the usurper, forced the Han empress dowager to hand over the Seal. The empress dowager, in anger, threw the Seal on the ground, chipping one corner. Later, Wang Mang ordered the corner to be restored with gold.  The Heirloom Seal was lost around the end of the [[Tang dynasty]] or during the [[Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms]] period.

body:

This was used as the symbol of the Free French during [[World War II]] from 1940 to 1943 to distinguish themselves from the Vichy regime that continued to use the normal French flag (or one with a battle-[[axe]] in the middle).

title: mixed_horns
body:
A single character having multiple different types of horns or horn-like things that look like they belong to different creatures, such as [[horns]] together with [[antlers]].


As a rule, to qualify for this tag it's not enough that the shape is different: the type must be different too. For example, someone like [[Mohg Lord Of Blood]] would not qualify for this tag because all of his horns look the same, despite having slightly different shapes. Those are simply [[asymmetrical horns]]. This tag only overlaps with asymmetrical horns if it's a distinctly different type of horn on each side of the head, such as a goat horn on one side and an antler on the other.

title: bishoujo_mangekyou:_tsumi_to_batsu_no_shoujo
body:
[b]Bishoujo Mangekyou: Tsumi to Batsu no Shoujo[/b] [i](Girl of Sin & Punishment)[/i], the fourth game of the series follows [[Kannagi Yuuma]], who is on leave from school due to being hospitalized in an incident. For the first time in a year, he finally reunited with his beautiful twin sister [[Kannagi Yuuri]] and began living with her. However, he has a secret that he cannot tell his sister: he is genuinely in love with her.

title: black_knight_squad_shi-ve.a
body:
A [[Mobile Suit]] introduced in the movie [[Gundam SEED Freedom]], it is a close combat machine piloted by [[Shura Serpentine]].
An advanced high-performance mobile suit developed by the Kingdom of Foundation using ZAFT technology. 
It utilizes many advanced technologies, such as the new Femto Technology Armor to defend against beam weaponry. 
Unlike the [[Black Knight Squad Rud-ro.A]] the Shi-ve.A is fitted more for close combat with 3 beam sabers, a Close-in Anti-Armor Blade "Dis Pater" Katar heat sword, beam blades installed in the feet and ROC Shield "Svarog", a shield with claw meant for crushing opponents.
It's last weapon is the Close-in Needle Projection System, which is designed to overwhelm Phase Shift Armor by rapid firing hundreds of needles at the target, however the weapon can only be used once per engagement due to limited ammo capacity.

title: monocular
body:
A monocular is a modified refracting [[telescope]] used to magnify images of distant objects by passing light through a series of lenses, usually prisms, the application of which results in a lightweight and compact telescope. The typical size and weight of a monocular is less than half that of a pair of binoculars with similar optical properties, making monoculars more portable and correspondingly less expensive. 

Monoculars are ideal for those who have vision in only one eye, or for places where compactness and low weight are important, such as hiking. Sometimes monoculars are also preferred when using both eyes through binoculars becomes difficult due to large eye changes or poor vision in one eye.

h4. See also

* [[Binoculars]]
* [[Spyglass]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monocular

title: indiana_jones_(series)
body:
An American media franchise based on the adventures of Dr. Henry Walton [[Indiana Jones]], a fictional professor of archaeology, played by [[Harrison Ford]], and created by [[George Lucas]].

The film series began in 1981 with the film [[Indiana Jones and the Raiders of the Lost Ark|Raiders of the Lost Ark]]. In 1984, a prequel, [[Indiana Jones AND The Temple of Doom| The Temple of Doom]], was released, and in 1989, a sequel, [[Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade|the Last Crusade]]. A fourth film followed in 2008, titled [[Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull|The Kingdom of the Crystal Skull]]. A final movie called Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny was released in 2023 but became a box office bomb.

title: chess
body:
A board game in which [[chess piece|pieces]] of different powers are moved around a [[checkered]] [[chessboard]]. The object of the game is to attack the opponent's king, and put him in a position wherein it's impossible to escape ("[[checkmate]]").

h4. See also

* [[chess clock]]
* [[Shogi]] - the Japanese variant of chess.
* [[Xiangqi]] - the Chinese variant of chess

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Chess":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chess

title: chess_clock
body:
A [[chess clock]] is a [[clock]] with two faces used in competitive chess games, that keeps track of the total time elapsed throughout all of a player's turns. The clock is set to a specific time at the start of a game, after which turns can be exchanged by pressing the button atop either clock face, automatically starting one and stopping the other.

h4. See also
* [[chess]] 
* [[chessboard]]

title: groucho_glasses
body:
Groucho glasses are a novelty disguise that caricatures Groucho Marx. Typically consisting of black horn-rimmed [[glasses]] with attached eyebrows, large plastic nose, and bushy [[mustache]], groucho glasses were first retailed in the 1940s. Groucho glasses today are often used as a shorthand for slapstick and general silliness such as the "world record most people at one time wearing Groucho Marx glasses;" currently 4077.

h4. See also

* [[Glasses]]
* [[Fake mustache]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Groucho glasses":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Groucho_glasses

title: mikimoto_haruhiko
body:
Legendary artist and character designer known for, amongst others, [[Tetsuwan Atom]] (80s version), [[Gunbuster]], [[Gundam]], [[Orguss]] and [[Macross]] character design.

While some of his most known and popular character designing work began in the [[1980s_(style)|1980s]], he continued being quite prolific during the [[1990s_(style)|1990s]] and the [[2000s_(style)|2000s]]. Still doing mostly manga work up to this day, with a much more modern style.

h4. See also

title: pochimaru_(vtuber)_(1st_costume)
body:
The original appearance of [[Pochimaru (vtuber)|]], as seen in post #4635082, which she used until she debuted her [[pochimaru (vtuber) (2nd costume)|next default]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] and [[blue eyes]] with [[horizontal pupils]], a [[small breasts|modest bust]], and a [[mole under mouth]]. The base of the costume consists of a black zipper [[crop top]], black [[highleg panties]], [[shorts]], [[thighhighs]], white [[sneakers]], [[tentacles]] to her back, [[head wings]] and eyes as an [[hair ornament|accessory]], and [[tinted eyewear|tinted]] [[goggles]].

Her regular appearance makes her shorts [[black shorts|black]], themes her thighhighs with a starfish appearances, and has her have [[detached sleeves|detached red and white sleeves]]. She would additionally debut a variant where she has a full [[white jacket|white]] [[cropped jacket|cropped]] jacket and full [[pantyhose]] instead. Later on, she also received accessories to add in place, such as a [[white shirt]] with her logo on the front.

title: kumoi_ichirin
body:
The "Guarding and Guarded Giant Wheel".

Stage 3 mid-boss and boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Undefined Fantastic Object]], and later a playable character in [[Hopeless Masquerade]].

A youkai with the ability to use her [i]nyūdō[/i] partner [[Unzan]] in combat. She is one of the followers of [[Hijiri Byakuren]], whom she is trying to free. Ichirin is a [[Buddhist nun]], wearing a black [[kesa]], a blue [[hood]] and a red [[pendant]]. She has [[blue eyes]] and [[blue hair]]. In her hands, she holds a golden [[ring]]/[[hoop]].

Appears to have developed a competitive rivalry and friendship with [[Mononobe no Futo]] as a result of their partnership in [[Antinomy of Common Flowers]].

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Ichirin Kumoi":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Ichirin_Kumoi

title: huh?_cat_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] involves a clip of a confused or shocked-looking cat making a "huh?" sound with its mouth open and eyes wide. Gained further popularity in Japan in early 2024 and is often combined with the [[rambling goat (meme)|rambling goat meme]], resulting in the cat being confused by the goat's gibberish.

This meme, along with other cat-themed memes, is often bundled together as a part of the "cat meme" clips in Japan, and thus they often appeared together.

h4. Other "Cat memes"
* [[Cat covering ears (meme)]]
* [[Chipi Chipi Chapa Chapa (meme)]]
* [[Happy happy happy cat (meme)]]
* [[I don't like your girlfriend cat (meme)]]
* [[Pop cat (meme)]]
* [[Sad banana cat (meme)]]
* [[Talking cats (meme)]]

h4. External links
* "Know Your Meme: Huh? Cat":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/huh-cat
* "YouTube: Cat saying Huh!":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xVWeRnStdSA

body: A [[meme]] originated from a TikTok clip featuring an edited clip of two [[cat]]s, with the left one making a sound as if it was talking and the right one that responds only with a light "meow" and a scared/sad expression. Usually edited with the context that the first cat is scolding the second one.

title: toyota_86
body:
Sports car jointly developed by [[subaru_(brand)|Subaru]] and [[Toyota]], considered the spiritual successor to the [[toyota_sprinter_trueno|Toyota AE86]]. 

The first generation 86 (ZN6) also sold as the [[Scion FR-S]] (US & Canada formerly before being rebadged back to the 86), the GT86 (Europe) and the [[Subaru BRZ]] (ZC6).

The second generation Subaru BRZ (ZD8) launched in 2020, and the badge-engineered Toyota version was introduced later in 2021, changing its name to GR86 (ZN8).

h4. See also

* [[List of ground vehicles]]

title: fallen_throne
body:
Created by Lord Aardvark. Fallen Throne is an adult-oriented high fantasy universe whose primary medium is the Source Filmmaker.

Fallen Throne takes place on the precipice of political unrest in the Dark Elvish city of Vael'Aser. The country is on the brink of civil war and is facing challenges from a number of different factions. Nualia, Queen of the Dark Elves, faces determined opposition from Mujeri and her purist Sisters of Vael'Yun, and the loyalties of the Aristocracy are torn.

In order to maintain the unity of Vael'Aser, Nualia may have to reconsider her current policies and seek outside help to impose martial law and quell the internal conflicts. Despite the limited number of allies she has, the Queen will have to use every means at her disposal to achieve her goals.
Someone is [[frown|frowning]] with [[one eye closed]].

title: hetzel_(fire_emblem)
body: An NPC in [[Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance]] and a minor antagonist in [[Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn]]. The weak-willed Duke of Asmin and a member of the Begnion Senate, he feels immense guilt for his complacency in the atrocities commited by [[Lekain]] and the rest of the senate. However, he lacks the courage to properly stand against Lekain and his actions.

title: present_from_lemon
body: "Present from LEMON" is a manga by [[Katsura Masakazu]]. Serialized in Weekly Shonen Jump from issue 33 to 51 in 1987, it follows the story of Sawaguchi Remon, who dreams of becoming a singer like his late father. Despite being an idol-themed work, it was neatly wrapped up in just two volumes. The manga focuses on Remon's growth and journey in the entertainment industry, blending elements of sports manga with the world of idols. The story revolves around Remon's pursuit of his father's legacy and his path to stardom as both an idol and a singer.

title: tsukikawa_chili
body:
Character from the series [[PriPara]].

Chiri has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] that she wears as [[two side up]], with [[blunt bangs]], [[blunt ends]] and an [[ahoge]]. She usually wears a [[school uniform]] that consists of a [[pink cardigan]] with [[long sleeves]] that she stretches [[sleeves past fingers|past her fingers]] sometimes to hide her shyness, a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] with [[short sleeves]] and a [[pink bow]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[blue skirt]] with [[suspender skirt|suspenders]] attached to it, [[white socks]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]]. 

When in her [[idol clothes|PriPara form]], Chiri's eyes change to [[blue eyes|blue]] and her hair becomes [[green hair|green]]. Her main outfit consists of a [[crescent hair ornament]], a [[detached collar|detached]] [[purple collar]], a [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[purple dress]] with [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[purple sleeves]], [[leg warmers]] and [[purple footwear|purple]] [[shoes]]. She is often seen [[holding fan|holding]] a [[folding fan|folding]] [[hand fan]].

title: reona_west
body:

Reona has a [[mole under eye]], [[pink eyes]], [[short hair|short]] and [[curly hair|curly]] [[pink hair]] some of which reaches [[hair between eyes|between his eyes]], with a [[side braid|braid]] worn on the left side of his head. Usually wears [[Paprika Private Academy school uniform]]. 

His default [[idol clothes|PriPara outfit]] consists of a [[white headwear|white]] [[sailor hat]] with a [[star hat ornament|star]] attached to the side, a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress]] with a [[red collar|red]] [[collared dress|collar]], [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[blue bow]] attached to the collar and a [[red bow]] as well as a [[white belt]] at the [[waist bow|waist]] area, [[wrist cuffs]], [[pink thighhighs]] and [[red footwear|red]] [[high heel boots|high heel]] [[boots]].

title: minami_mirei
body:
Character from the series [[PriPara]].

When performing, Mirei has [[short hair|short]] [[curly hair|curly]] [[blonde hair]] with [[cone hair bun|cone]] [[double bun|hair buns]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her default [[idol clothes|PriPara costume]] includes [[red bow|red]] and [[blue bow|blue]] [[hair bow]]s, a [[short dress|short]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[multicolored dress]] with a [[layered skirt]], [[striped thighhighs]] and [[mismatched footwear|mismatched]] [[high heel boots|high heel]] [[knee boots]].

Normally, she has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] that's tied in a [[ponytail]], [[brown eyes]] and wears [[under-rim eyewear|under-rim]] [[glasses]]. Usually seen wearing [[Paprika Private Academy school uniform]].

title: cockroach-chan_(harumina_mau)
body:
[[original|Original Character]] created by the artist [[Harumina Mau]].

She is one of the main characters in a comics saga which represents multiple [[arthropod girl|arthropod girls]].

She is a [[mini person|tiny]] [[cockroach girl]], who lives in an apartment with a human whose genre, identity and backstory is currently unknown. Despite her humanoind and adorable appearance, the human in the comic usually treats cockroach-chan as a normal cockroach. This situation leads to comical and sometimes heart-breaking situations. Although there are some exceptions too, where the human treats her kindly and with love.

She has [[brown hair|brown]] [[very long hair]] with [[antenna hair|antennas]], and [[gradient eyes]]. Her attire consists in a [[brown dress|brown]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[pleated dress|pleated]] dress with a [[black bowtie]], [[brown gloves]], [[brown pantyhose]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[mary janes]]. The artist always portrait her as a [[chibi]].

h4. Human Variant

On February 06, 2024, the artist created a human variant of cockroach-chan. This human variant contains a few changes in her appareance, such as reeplacing her normal gloves with [[elbow gloves]], the frills in her dress are yellow-colored, the collar of her dress resembles to a [[sailor collar]], and her [[antenna hair|antennas]] are abscent. The most notable change is her size, having the size of a normal human being, and she's treated as a normal girl by other persons. [i]See post #7183800 and post #7240395 for reference.[/i]

title: agyo_(housamo)
body:
A Transient originally from another world known as the Land of Wa, where he served as a shrine's guardian dog. With his partner-cum-grandfather figure, Ungyo, having been recently buried after fulfilling his duty, he is currently on the hunt for a new partner. Agyo's strong desire to become the perfect guardian dog fuels his search for a partner who will take his life's work equally as seriously.

https://housamo.wiki/Agyo#transient0

title: rhapsody_of_zephyr
body: Rhapsody of Zephyr is a 1998 Korean-made role-playing game and a side-story in The War of Genesis series. Unlike most other installments of the series, it has less tactical elements and is more close to the traditional Japanese-style RPG format.

title: heart_hands_trio
body:
Three individuals performing a united [[heart hands]] pose. A legendary technique said to hold power beyond human comprehension.

All three characters must contribute to the same heart for it to be considered a heart hands "trio", either by each forming part of the heart or by overlapping a [[heart hands]] over a [[heart hands duo]] (post #3369955).

If three characters are forming multiple sets of linked [[heart hands duo]]s, it's a [[heart hands duo chain]] instead.

title: lolibaba
body:
An old woman with the body of a child. 

This tag is for when a [[loli]] or [[child]] character behaves like an old woman or woman who is older than they appear, or when context (narrator text, dialogue) makes it obvious.

h4. Examples
* [[Kazayama Kizuna]] is explicitly called lolibaba in season 2 of Shield Hero - she is 18 years old but is lacking in secondary sexual characteristics
